page.title: 04Life of a Farmer
page.content:
The Barrells of Veddoes Farm.
The Barrells are like any other family except that they live on a farm. Their day in a general way is pretty much like ours. 6.30 a.m. They get up. 6.45 a.m. They milk the cows. 8.15 a.m. Breakfast. 8.30 a.m. Children go to school. They do all the small chores next like feeding the cattle, hens, calves and lambs. Most Wednesdays they go into town. Mr. Barrell goes to market by himself, but he never buys any cattle, which he hasn't done for seven years. At around six or seven hundred pounds each you can see why. Mrs Barrell depends heavily on her deep freeze and once in a while buys frozen food to put back in.
